intro: Ardisia missionis, commonly known as the Mission Island ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found on the island of Borneo. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
